title: AB 2453
content: The people of California enact the following. Section 53115.1 of the Government Code is amended to establish the State 911 Advisory Board, composed of various members appointed by the Governor representing different public safety organizations. The State 911 Advisory Board is composed of members appointed by the Governor, including representatives from the California Emergency Medical Services Authority and the telecommunications industry. Board members must have experience in the California 911 system, with at least two years as a Public Safety Answering Point manager or county coordinator. Members of the State 911 Advisory Board must have experience in the California 911 system and cannot have received a substantial portion of their income from the telecommunications industry in the two years prior to appointment. They serve at the pleasure of the Governor for up to two consecutive two-year terms, with exceptions for certain members. Advisory board members do not receive compensation but may be reimbursed for travel and per diem expenses. The State 911 Advisory Board meets quarterly in public sessions as per the Bagley-Keene Open Meeting Act. Administrative support is provided by the division. Members can designate a person to act on their behalf. A member of the advisory board must avoid involvement in any matter where there is a financial interest for themselves, their family, or an organization they are affiliated with. A member of the advisory board must avoid conflicts of interest in legal proceedings or matters where the board has a direct interest. Additionally, individuals with specific industry backgrounds are restricted from working in related fields for two years after leaving the board.
